definition: Tang Xianzu (1550-1616), Ming poet and dramatist, author of The Peony Pavilion 牡丹亭[Mu3 dan5 Ting2]
soup/hot or boiling water/decoction of medicinal herbs/water in which sth has been boiled

sentences.english: Ann: Why do you say that Tang Xianzu is Shakespare of China?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼你說湯顯祖是中國的莎幹比亞？

sentences.english: Tang Xianzu is a high-yield writer, his poetry and drama writings is abundant.
sentences.chinese: 湯顯祖是一個高產作家，他的詩歌戲劇創作頗爲豐富。

sentences.english: Tang Xianzu, a playwright of Ming Dynasty in 16th Century, was the coeval of Shakespeare of Britain.
sentences.chinese: 16世紀明代的湯顯祖與英國的莎士比亞是同時代人。

sentences.english: Tang Xianzu s perception of human nature determines his emphasis on emotion and truth in his perception of drama.
sentences.chinese: 湯顯祖的人性觀決定了其戲曲觀的重心是情與真。

sentences.english: The legent about the death of syphilis of Mr.
sentences.chinese: 湯顯祖死因是梅毒不足信。

definition: scholar of the rationalist school of Neo-Confucianism 理學|理学[Li3 xue2]
to write for sb else/a lawyer who writes legal documents for his clients
to comment/a point by point commentary
"sage of poetry", epithet of Du Fu 杜甫[Du4 Fu3]
A New Account of the Tales of the World, collection of anecdotes, conversations, remarks etc of historic personalities, compiled and edited by Liu Yiqing 劉義慶|刘义庆[Liu2 Yi4 qing4]
Ma Zhiyuan (c. 1250-1321), Yuan dynasty dramatist in the 雜劇|杂剧[za2 ju4] tradition of musical comedy, one of the Four Great Yuan Dramatists 元曲四大家[Yuan2 qu3 Si4 Da4 jia1]
Feng Menglong (1574-1646), late Ming dynasty novelist writing in colloquial (baihua), author of Stories Old and New 古今小說|古今小说[Gu3 jin1 Xiao3 shuo1]
a Yuan dynasty form of musical comedy
Xie Lingyun (385-433) poet during Song of the Southern Dynasties 南朝宋
